intro: Coprosma velutina, commonly known as velvet coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, dark green, and covered in fine hairs, while its small white flowers appear in clusters during late spring to early summer. Velvet coprosma is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade.
